text:
Ensign is a city in Gray County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 187 people lived there.
History.
Ensign was first called Lone Lake, and planned out about 1886. It was renamed Ensign in 1888 in honor of its founder, G. L. Ensign.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 187 people, 76 households, and 52 families living in the city.
Economy.
The Gray County Wind Farm near Ensign is the largest wind farm in Kansas.
Education.
Ensign is a part of USD 102 Cimarron-Ensign. Ensign had its own high school until 1984. The Ensign High School mascot was Ensign Wildcats.
